message: Would like to pull in some ideas for the event to celebrate the new space.  Is anyone interested in doing a flyer?
When are you thinking for this event?
A few weeks away... Time for us to promote it
Yah! We should make a Flyer to put the rest to shame! Maybe festooned w/LEDs?

LEDS would be too time/capital intensive.  But riffing off that idea, how about print a circuit board on the invite, and if people show up, we can trace the ... traces with a conductive pen, and have it form a cirucit?  Maybe something where you could link the postcards together to form a longer circuit....  Now, what to have it do...?
Nice idea! Maybe a touch piano, or just a simple blinking led (they can pick up LED at gala)
The corner can fold over the battery to make a battery compartment http://twitpic.com/4w660s
Idea: finger-tic-tac-toe, you have to close the circuit by keeping your finger on the post-card, and you play tic-tac-toe, it's like Twister as well, as you try and keep your fingers on the card...

Are there any conductive pens at the space that can be used for experimenting?  Copper tape? Is there budget for either?  If anyone sees promotional postcards out and about, grab them so that we can experiment on them.  (I'm suspicious that typical glossy promotional postcards might not have good ink adherence.)
http://twitpic.com/4weklp
How will the tic-tac-toe know who's finger is which?
better picture of the traces http://twitpic.com/4whgup
Hrm.  Good point man, I'm just spitballing.
This is a simple 555 organ http://www.design-technology.info/ks3/y8/page9.htm
@A1Ari 2 words: Amazon Prime, Baby. OK, 3 words.
I was thinking a simple stencil could be made to allow for chip mounting.  Bend the chip feet outwards, place it on the stenciled trace and then tape the whole chip down.

Hrm, maybe a game of "telephone".  Each card gets assigned a resistor network value, and you have to implement it yourself wiht a circuit, we connect the cards together, and they should add to an output value at the end of the chain....
IF everybody shows up, that is... They may need to function independently as well, perhaps, or work in different combinations.
@Psytek can you test whether a finger will close a circuit trace.  (Yes I may be volunteering you for an electric shock, haha.)
nice
Conductive glue made out of powdered graphite.  http://www.instructables.com/id/Conductive-Glue-And-Conductive-Thread-Make-an-LED/step1/Make-Conductive-Glue-Conductive-Paint-and-Conduc/
